revised_title: Advancements in Achromatic Lens Design for Telescopes
tldr: The author, Peter Barlow, discusses the principle of construction and general application of the negative achromatic lens in telescopes and eyepieces. He explains the advantages of using the negative achromatic lens, which include lengthening the focus, improving image quality, and increasing the telescope's power. Barlow also suggests that the negative lens can be used to create telescopes with adjustable powers and offers recommendations for opticians on how to construct and apply the lens.
